snippet: An annual study scheduled to be released this week found that the proportion of working-age residents who were members of unions had increased in the last 18 months to nearly one in four.
abstract: Annual study scheduled for release from City University of New York Graduate Center faculty suggests proportion of working-age New York City residents who identify themselves as union members has increased in last 18 months to nearly one in four.
lead_paragraph: An annual study scheduled to be released this week found that the proportion of working-age residents who were members of unions had increased in the last 18 months to nearly one in four.

headline.main: Study Suggests a Rebound for Union Jobs in New York
headline.print_headline: Study Suggests a Rebound for Union Jobs in New York
